result.execSummary:
The defendant Brianna Marie Bankston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

with credit for 1 day.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

***Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence***

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brianna Marie Bankston

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Judgment entered for unpaid fines, forfeitures, and other financial obligations.

ADDRESS INFO for Brianna Marie Bankston
Current: 2429 W. Auer Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53206-1221   (Effective: 01-10-2017)
Prior: 3155 North 24th Place, Milwaukee, WI 53216
Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

Court sentences defendant to serve 1 day in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $156.00 payable to Kohl's. Defendant to pay restitution by 12/2/2016. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge. Defendant to pay DNA surcharge by 12/2/2016. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 

Court ordered defendant to pay all costs, surcharges and restitution by 12/2/2016. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 

Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence.

Defendant Brianna Marie Bankston in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Brianna Marie Bankston in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Case to be heard along with other pending matter in Branch 31. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 31. All parties are notified that effective 12-01-15 this case will be assigned to Reserved Branch, Branch 31, in Room 615 of the Courthouse. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kohl's department store and Bayshore Mall

Defendant Brianna Marie Bankston in court.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  OCCR Tape#15-198/2:00
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.37  for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brianna Marie Bankston not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
She called the court at 2:45 informing us that she was in a car accident on her way to court and that she is in the hospital. I rescheduled the case until Wednesday at 1:30 Rm. 221, out of custody court. I informed her to bring in her paperwork from the hospital.  Initial appearance scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Prior: 3155 North 24th Place, Milwaukee, WI 53206
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 10/12/15 @ 1:30 pm
